columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for the customer making a payment.
columns.payment_method_code: The code representing the customer's preferred payment method.

Customer_Payment_Methods.table_description: The table stores information on customer payment methods.

columns.invoice_number: The unique identifier for each invoice issued in the system.
columns.invoice_status_code: The code indicating the current status of the invoice.
columns.invoice_date: The date and time when the invoice was created.

Invoices.table_description: The table tracks invoices issued within the e-commerce system.

columns.order_id: The unique identifier for each order placed in the system.
columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for the customer placing the order.
columns.order_status_code: The code indicating the current status of the order.
columns.date_order_placed: The date and time when the order was placed.

Orders.table_description: The table records orders made by customers in the e-commerce system.

columns.product_id: The unique identifier for each product in the inventory.
columns.parent_product_id: The unique identifier for the parent product, if applicable.
columns.product_name: The name given to the product for identification and marketing.
columns.product_price: The selling price of the product in the marketplace.
columns.product_color: The color options available for the product.
columns.product_size: The size options available for the product.
columns.product_description: The detailed description highlighting the product's features.

Products.table_description: The table catalogs products available in the e-commerce platform.

columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for each customer in the database.
columns.gender_code: The gender of the customer, represented by a single character.
columns.customer_first_name: The first name of the customer for identification.
columns.customer_middle_initial: The middle initial of the customer, if provided.
columns.customer_last_name: The last name of the customer for identification.
columns.email_address: The email address used for customer communications.
columns.login_name: The username created by the customer for account access.
columns.login_password: The password set by the customer to secure their account.
columns.phone_number: The contact phone number of the customer.
columns.address_line_1: The primary address line for billing or shipping purposes.
columns.town_city: The city or town where the customer resides.
columns.county: The county associated with the customer's address.
columns.country: The country of residence for the customer.

Customers.table_description: The table holds customer information for the e-commerce platform.

columns.order_item_id: The unique identifier for each order item in the order.
columns.product_id: The unique identifier for the product included in the order.
columns.order_id: The unique identifier for the order containing the item.
columns.order_item_status_code: The current status of the order item, such as 'Delivered' or 'Out of Stock'.

Order_Items.table_description: The table tracks items within customer orders in the e-commerce system.

columns.shipment_id: The unique identifier for each shipment processed in the system.
columns.order_id: The unique identifier for the order associated with the shipment.
columns.invoice_number: The unique identifier for the invoice linked to the shipment.
columns.shipment_tracking_number: The number used to track the shipment's progress.
columns.shipment_date: The date and time when the shipment was dispatched.

Shipments.table_description: The table records shipment details for orders within the e-commerce platform.

columns.shipment_id: The unique identifier for each shipment associated with order items.
columns.order_item_id: The unique identifier for the order item included in the shipment.

Shipment_Items.table_description: The table records items included in each shipment for orders.
